Package calc

Interface Calculator

All Known Implementing Classes:
CalcMain
public interface Calculator
Interface for the infix/postfix Calculator.

  • Method Details

    • calcInfix

      double calcInfix(String[] expression) throws CalcException
      performs the calculation on the given input in infix notation. Supported operations are: addition (+), substraction (-), multiplication (*), and division (/). Also parenthesis '(', ')' are allowed.
      Parameters:
      expression - the input to the calculation in infix form e.g., ["(", "1.5", "+" , "2", ")", "*", "(", "3", "-", "4", ")"]
      Returns:
      the result of the calculation, e.g. -3.5 for the above input
      Throws:
      CalcException - if anything goes wrong during the calculation (e.g., in case of an illegal input)
      
double calcInfix(String[] expression) throws CalcException;

    • calcPostfix

      double calcPostfix(String[] expression) throws CalcException
      performs the calculation on the given input in postfix notation. Supported operations are: addition (+), substraction (-), multiplication (*), and division (/)
      Parameters:
      expression - the input to the calculation in postfix form e.g., ["1.5", "2", "+", "3", "4", "-", "*"]
      Returns:
      the result of the calculation, e.g. -3.5 for the above input
      Throws:
      CalcException - if anything goes wrong during the calculation (e.g., in case of an illegal input)
      
double calcPostfix(String[] expression) throws CalcException;

    • getPrec

      static int getPrec(String op)
      
static int getPrec(String op) {
    if ("*".equals(op) || "/".equals(op))
        return 2;
    if ("+".equals(op) || "-".equals(op))
        return 1;
    return -1;
}

    • infix2postfix

      static String[] infix2postfix(String[] expression)
      Converts a given infix-expression into postfix notation.
      Parameters:
      expression - the expression in infix notation
      Returns:
      the expression in postfix notation
      
static String[] infix2postfix(String expression[]) {
    List result = new ArrayList<>();
    Stack stack = new Stack<>();
    for (String exp : expression) {
        int prec = getPrec(exp);
        if (prec > 0) { //operation
            while (!stack.empty() && prec <= getPrec(stack.peek())) {
                result.add(stack.pop());
            }
            stack.push(exp);
        } else if ("(".equals(exp)) {
            stack.push("(");
        } else if (")".equals(exp)) {
            while (!stack.peek().equals("(")) {
                result.add(stack.pop());
            }
            stack.pop();
        } else { //assumes to be a number
            result.add(exp);
        }
    }
    while (!stack.isEmpty()){ //pop everything remaining
        result.add(stack.pop());
    }
    return result.toArray(new String[]{});
}
